text.headline: History of Machine Learning
text.text: Throughout the years, machine learning has been growing and evolving at an incredible pace. A lot of achievements and inventions has been made these past few years.

media.caption: Warren McCulloch and Walter Pitts portrait

text.headline:
Pitts and McCulloch's Neural Network
1943
text.text: In 1943, Warren McCulloch and Walter Pitts wrote a paper about how neurons function. Using electrical circuits, they created a simple neural network in order to demonstrate how neurons in the brain might work.

text.headline: Turing Test
text.text: Turing Test, also called as Imitation Game, was conceived by Alan Turing in 1950. It evaluates the ability of a machine to mimic any human-like intelligence. If the human user can not distinguish if the respondent was human or machine based on their responses, the machine would pass the test.

text.headline: Arthur Samuel (1901-1990)
text.text: Arthur Samuel, an AI pioneer who coined the term "Machine Learning" in 1952. He first developed a computer program about checkers in 1950s. In 1959, he published a book titled "Some Studies in Machine Learning Using the Game of Checkers."

text.headline: Mark I Perceptron
text.text: Mark I Perceptron is a supervised image classification learning system. In 1957, Frank Rosenblatt combined model of brain cell interaction by Donald Hebb created in 1949 and Arthur Samuel's discoveries to create the perceptron.

text.headline: ELIZA Chatbot
text.text: Eliza, created by MIT professor Joseph Weizenbaum in 1964, was one of the earliest AI to imitate a conversation like a human. ELIZA mimics a therapist by asking questions regarding what you feel.

text.headline: Nearest Neighbor Algorithm
text.text: Nearest neighbor algorithm, one of the most used algorithm in machine learning, also known as K-Nearest Neighbor or KNN. It uses proximity to make classifications or predictions. This algorithm was used for the Travelling Salesman Problem.

text.headline: Google
text.text: In 1998, Google was founded by Larry Page and Sergey Brin while they were Ph.D. students at Stanford University. In the same year, Google launched their search engine in which machine learning is applied. It learns from user interactions to improve search results.

text.headline: ChatGPT
text.text: ChatGPT, created by OpenAI and was launched in 2022, is an interactive AI chatbot which uses machine learning in order to understand and mimic human-like conversations. Users can ask ChatGPT about different topics and it will provide information based on the user's prompt.
